text: good morning uh I am sarak Jen a senior

Innovations and the security
enhancements made to Kos
engineering so lmas chos is a cncf
incubating project that allows users to
practice chos engineering on their Cloud
native applications so with the mission
of making chos engineering accessible
and secure so key part of Litas Kos
growth has been our mentorship programs
and the community so we participate in
multiple mentorship program and we Tred
to provide mentorship to the open source
enthusiasts and the first is the LFX
mentorship so we have already onboarded

and the key Focus has always been on
adding new features and Community
Management so good part about this
program is that the mentees they not
only stay with us during the term they
actively contribute during the term and
they also decide to stay with us after
their term gets completed we have one of
the guys who started off as mentees is
now a maintainer of the project and uh
he also leads a open source contribution
Academy in South Korea where he
basically provide mentorship to the open
source enthusiasts in South Korea and so
yeah so lias Kos also participates in
the open source contribution Academy in
South Korea as well next up we have
Google summer of code so in the recent
terms the main focus has been on adding
first test to improve the code quality
and make the product more
stable so for a product like litmus Kos
um which requires some privileged access
to inject Kos into user system security
becomes a very important
factor so uh recently a security audit
has been performed by the 7A security
team and as part of of which we have
fixed vulnerabilities in our Helm charts
we have enhanced our CI pipelines to
scan and identify any vulnerabilities
and G LS at the earlier stages itself we
have enhanced our security policies we
have added API protection we have added
support for https the support was there
already but we have made https as a
default configuration we have added
support for mtls earlier we used to
support TLS now it's mtls as well we
have added course validation in our
graph Quil servers as well in our
authentication
servers then we have added admission
controller to restrict malicious users
from uh creating privileged ports by
creating validation web Hooks and
similarly we have added Network policies
and keyo policies for uh validation web
books so apart from using admission
controller users can also add their own
network policies or keyo policies then
there has been some other modifications
that we have made to make platform more
secure so like strict password
validation user will now have to um
enter a secure password at the time of
account creation then support to enable
and disable graphical introspection and
U support for JWT secret creation so at
the time of login we uh basically store
the JWT secrets in our DB to make the
whole authentication process more
secure so they say that you can judge
how good a product is by reading its
documentation so a great product
requires a great documentation so we
have had a tech doc analysis evaluation
that was completed by Nate and Dave from
cncf team so as part of uh which we have
removed our obsolete uh websites the old
tutorials we have archived our old
litmas website uh and V1 and V2 docs so
we have um released litmas 3.0 so we
have the V3 docs available we have
updated table of content and overview
for consistency we have added a new
tutorial section for docs uh to Dos for
uh our new users we have reorganized
getting started and concept section in
the docs we have removed duplicate
install instruction then as we told as I
told that we have um like we have the V3
docs already released so we have removed
the references from V1 and V2 docu
documentation we have relocated how to
contribute section to improve structure
so all these uh changes have been made
to um ensure that users can uh navigate
through the docs easily and for a better
user experience soart from this we have
also made some other changes in the
project or other updations in the
project like some bu fixes some feature
addition some performance
optimizations so yeah so that was all
about uh like that was an overview of
what's going on around the project um
and we would love to connect you on the
